section.title: indentation
section.p: Indentation is four spaces - no tabs.

section.title: Variables
section.p: Variable names use camel case with the first letter lower-case.

list.list-item: stanzaName - the name of the stanza
nameIdx - loop variable for iterating through a list of names

section.p: Variable names should be descriptive. Avoid i, j, etc.

section.title: Braces
section.p: C allows braces to be excluded for a single statement. However, braces should be used when the control statement (if, while, etc.) spans more than one line or the statement to be executed spans more than one line.
Braces needed when the if is more than one line.

section.title: Data Types
section.p:
Don't get exotic - use the simplest type that will work.
Use int for general cases. int will be at least 32 bits. When not using int use one of the defined types.

section.title: Macros
section.p: Don't use a macro when a function could be used instead. Macros make it hard to measure code coverage.

section.title: Objects
section.p: Object oriented programming is used extensively. Object pointer is always referred to as `this`.

section.title: Uncoverable/Uncovered Code
section.p: Code coverage is an important part of !!!.

section.title: Uncoverable Code
section.p: The uncoverable keyword marks code that can never be covered. For instance, a function that never returns because it always throws a error. Uncoverable code should be rare to non-existent outside the common libraries and test code.
section.code-block: } // {uncoverable - function throws error so never returns}
section.p: Subsequent code that is uncoverable for the same reason is marked with // {+uncoverable}.

section.title: Uncovered Code
section.p: Marks code that is not tested for one reason or another. This should be kept to a minimum and an excuse given for each instance.
section.code-block: exit(EXIT_FAILURE); // {uncoverable - test harness does not support non-zero exit}
section.p: Subsequent code that is uncovered for the same reason is marked with `// {+uncovered}`.
